title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: It gave him a burst of  something like energy. He had the phone reconnected – it only took three weeks and another deposit – and scoured the thrift shops on Leith Walk and Great Junction Street, picking up a mattress, pillows, a couple of  chairs, a desk. He ate fi sh suppers and Chinese carryouts and managed to restrict his drinking to cans of  beer.
